clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring by Microdialysis of Postoperative Complications After Proctectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Microdialysis to Monitor Postoperative Outcomes After Proctectomy

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé
France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to monitor by microdialysis the postoperative outcomes in order to identify anastomotic leaks after rectal surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.description: the anastomotic leaks rate is defined as the number of anastomotic leaks validated by a CT scan or at the clinical examination

secondary_outcome.description: the surgical site infection rate is defined as the number of infection near the incision
the functional success of microdialysis is defined as abnormal values localised at the microdialysis catheter

arm_group.description: At the end of the surgery the cma microdialysis catheter is placed near the anastomosis

intervention.description: the microdialysis catheters are sold by CMA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- rectal disease requiring proctectomy with anastomosis and stomy
- proctectomy by laparoscopy or laparotomy
- written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of colorectal surgery
- rectal surgery without anastomosis
- breastfeeding or pregnancy
- ASA score IV
